name: Mike Long
text:
Fairly new restaurant, but for it being so new it’s an amazing hole in the wall restaurant.
After I had the hand held beef stew, I really wish I could have handled to eat another thing from the menu.
Good drink selection, food is great and unique, and crazy atmosphere.
Only issue I had was that I don’t like the fries, but I don’t like fries typically.
A must try in my book.
Only recommendation I would have for the restaurant is don’t change the food, it’s great as it is.

name: Kelsy P Hill
text: We went late on a Saturday night. With some events happening around town, they were slower than usual, so we got to have excellent conversations and service with the owner, Bea, and the staff while sitting at the bar. I had the Duchess Diesel Chips, and my husband had the SpagBol. Both were absolutely delicious and we will definitely be back. The public house vibe is so welcoming and the service is fantastic. 10/10 recommend!

name: Tyler Winstead
text: The Little London is a delicious place with a wonderful atmosphere and super friendly staff. Everyone was kind and welcoming, and the food and drinks were amazing! I got the beef pie which was perfectly flaky and tender. I can’t wait to go back and highly recommend stopping by!

name: Omar Jackson
text:
The best bread pudding you’ll ever get in the south! While I’ve never been across the Pond personally, I felt like I was in the movies. The atmosphere provides an escape from your normal everyday dinning experience. The customer service is out of this world. Matt & B sure do know how to not only make you feel welcomed but a part of the family.

I didn’t even mention that everything on the menu was phenomenal. If you’re an open to new experience and great food GO To LITTLE LODON, you won’t be disappointed!!!

name: Joshua Melvin
text: The food was alright, but definitely not commensurate with the price tag—I only tasted the fish and chips and Bolognese, so other menu items may be better.  The drinks are $2 a pop, come in a small solo-type plastic cup, and there are no refills beyond water.  The atmosphere is comfortable and the staff were great, so overall an enjoyable visit.

resp.text: We are sorry that you did not feel our food was worth the price point, but we definitely offer free re-fills on soft drinks. Currently we are doing plastic cups on soft drinks until we can find more staff. Thanks for giving us a go!

name: Pam Joachim
text: So glad to finally experience eating at the restaurant now that it has opened. Still the same great good as the food truck, but now there's the atmosphere & camaraderie to add to the experience. Can't wait to go back.

name: Tim Hart
text: I love the ambience and the feeling like you're at home at the restaurant. The fish and chips are outstanding but a little pricey. The Guinness beer was delicious and very well poured.

name: Ian Crawford
text: One of the most unique dining experiences in Birmingham. I always thought I didn't like fish and chips but I'd just never had The Little London's. Consider me a convert

name: Tyler M (SuperFlyGingerGuy)
text: Awesome atmosphere and you won't find better fish & chips anywhere! Also, recommend trying their tea cocktails, SO GOOD!

name: Tina Privette
text: We love everything about this restaurant! It’s like settling in at home for a delicious meal. Can’t go wrong with fish and chips or the beef shepherds pie. But save room for dessert. The bread puddings are spectacular. Stop in for take and bake dishes for an easy dinner at home as well. We love to bake the lemon blueberry bread pudding at home.

name: John Theabolt
text: Beyond Imagination and Wildest Dreams!  I spent a "J-term" studying in London while at University and her food, her magnificent food, is even better than I remember!! Please buy her dinners, puff pastry creations, side dishes, but more than anything, please bring your friends and family to enjoy it along with you!! I'm just certain you will not be disappointed!

name: Katty Lincuante
text: If u want to feel like on yr home but out....you have to go there!!!!

name: Zach McAuley
text: Whatever you may be thinking after looking at the menu prices, take the portions into consideration. They are huge! This is ultra comfort food. The pies are great and our kid loves the pasta. This will be a great hangout once the pandemic is under control. Check them out!

name: Allan Harris
text: Great food, drinks, and atmosphere! It's your living room away from home

name: Lee Winnige
text: English pub style restaurant/bar. Eclectic interior with friendly staff, great food and atmosphere.

name: Erika McDonald
text: I love this place!! Absolutely the best fish and chips! Their cabbage slaw is delicious as well! I order that every time because it's just so good. The owner is so pleasant and kind and makes going there such a wonderful experience. Little London is such a gem!

name: Reuben Fleischer
text: Glad they are open again. Good to get some English fare in the area!

name: Ann Whitaker
text:
Wonderful food, prepared, sold by beautiful loving people. The fish & chips are the best and I don't like fish, unless it is from here. The chicken pie is my favorite.
Not biased at all, my family. ❤

name: Tyler Gay
text: Anything less than a five star review for this place is not accurate. It’s quite literally like walking into a pub in London except the food is better. Bea is delightful and attentive ((despite being a Manchester United fan!)jk Bea)). Do yourself a favor and support this gem we have here in Birmingham.

name: Nan Rust
text: The fish and chips are amazing! Loved the masaman curry pie too. The owners are lovely. You have to try this place of you want a taste of Britain!

name: Mary Kate Young
text: Love this fun, special restaurant! We ate dinner at the newly opened Pub and it was SO yummy. The staff is very friendly! The food is delicious! They have a great selection of “take and bake” type items too. It’s a great change of pace in the restaurant selections. Welcome to West Homewood Little London! Can’t wait to go back!

name: Robyn Mielke
text: One of my absolute favorite places in B'ham. The food is always amazing, as is the staff. I try to stop by as often as I can! (The beef stew pie is my fave, but I've never had a bad thing here)

name: Andrew Allen
text: Great food and great people.  A local business that needs to be supported.  Cause if all we got is chain restaurants left after Covid I'm moving

name: Shannon David
text: Great food!  Take-n-bake pies are amazing, highly recommend the brisket pies. 👍

name: chris collins
text: Fish and chips are the play. Fish was done perfectly. Chips were good but could have been crisper. Good stuff

name: Rachael Robbins
text: This place is awesome. The food is great and you get so much of it too. You can really tell they put a lot of care into it! Plus the owner is super nice to boot!

name: S W
text: Absolutely delicious great place!

name: Chris L
text: Amazing food and amazing staff. Highly recommend the beef pie but there really is no going wrong.

name: Brenda Reid
text: Great British food. I have eaten from their food truck, but not at their restaurant yet.

name: alesia adams
text: Great british pub phone and delightful owners!  Definitely recommend.

name: Johnathan Corrales
text: Quaint and cosy setting with confort food to boot! Welcoming staff and a menu with something for everyone

name: Tia Wheeler
text: Fish and chips were very good, but not a lot of other traditional English foods.

name: Justin Warden
text:
I'M SO HAPPYYYY!!! When this team was just a food truck and popping around town I liked them, but did not chase them around much. Then they started to throw down some roots in West Homewood...and they have done a marvelous job so far! They do a splendid job of bringing the fun/neat things about London over to Birmingham, AL. (Including the epic double decker red bus which maybe you can eat in?)

Anywho, let's talk about the here and now. They have delightful food, the people are great, and they're putting everything they can into making business work right now; and it's a beautiful/inspiring thing to see. They eventually want it to be a full blown pub (but with all of the pandemic happenings it's kept them from fully realizing the dream yet), but for now it is a beautiful takeout/carryout/to-go restaurant with bakery and other local vendors' goods and more of their own take and prepare at home foods. Check out my photos to help make sense of all of that :)

So far I've loved:
Beef Pie
Vegetable Masaman Curry
Chips
Bread Pudding
Mixed Leaf Salad
Chocolate Pie/Tort Thing
Scone with Clotted Cream and Jam
The Strawberry Shortbreads are amazing (my family wanted way more)
(Nuzzi Gelato at least for now I guess)

I'm not really a huge fan of fried fish, but I know other people like it.

I would recommend calling ahead for your order unless you are just wanting to peruse the store for 15-30 minutes while you wait for your food. Or you could just get some of the food yourself from the freezer or fridge and take it home to prepare it. I love the versatility of this place and the resilience they have to do everything they can to try to get this bus rolling in the midst of a pandemic.

Top marks to these chaps. I'll be back many a time. Cheers!!

name: Veronica Meadows
text: Loved it! So good and such a fun experience!

name: Summer Rae
text: Rosemary beef pie and Yorkshire pudding were amazing!!

name: J. M.
text: The food and service is great !

name: Hugh Leader
text: Very good!

name: Tamara Higgins
text: Everything was delicious!

name: Mario Neavez
text: Fish and chips are in point.
